svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - July 15 2023

title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 15, 2023" date: "2023-07-15"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
• Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim : Dencun updates:
devnet 7 had 9k blobs , mostly stable, excludes Erigon; devnet 8 will be spun up after Hive tests pass
& a local testnet run Next CL upgrade named Electra; proposed Electra EIPs so far : EIP7002 (EL
triggerable exits), EIP6110 (supply validator deposits on chain) & EIP7251 (increase max effective
balance) Discussion on active validator set growth & proposal to cap validator churn limit
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
• Dencun updates: devnet 7 had 9k blobs , mostly stable, excludes Erigon; devnet 8 will be spun up
after Hive tests pass & a local testnet run
Dencun updates: devnet 7 had 9k blobs , mostly stable, excludes Erigon; devnet 8 will be spun up after
Hive tests pass & a local testnet run
• Next CL upgrade named Electra; proposed Electra EIPs so far : EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits),
EIP6110 (supply validator deposits on chain) & EIP7251 (increase max effective balance)
Next CL upgrade named Electra; proposed Electra EIPs so far : EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits), EIP6110
(supply validator deposits on chain) & EIP7251 (increase max effective balance)
• Discussion on active validator set growth & proposal to cap validator churn limit
Discussion on active validator set growth & proposal to cap validator churn limit
• EIP4844: Latest EIP4844 implementer call. Notes from Terence : devnet 7 blob spamming, devnet 8
planning, blob retrieval endpoint usefulness for L2s & tuning blob gossip parameters KZG Ceremony 120k
contributions, closes July 23
• Latest EIP4844 implementer call. Notes from Terence : devnet 7 blob spamming, devnet 8 planning,
blob retrieval endpoint usefulness for L2s & tuning blob gossip parameters
Latest EIP4844 implementer call. Notes from Terence : devnet 7 blob spamming, devnet 8 planning, blob
retrieval endpoint usefulness for L2s & tuning blob gossip parameters
• KZG Ceremony 120k contributions, closes July 23
KZG Ceremony 120k contributions, closes July 23
Layer 1
• Erigon updated 2023 roadmap : single major EL upgrade and Caplin (CL client)
Erigon updated 2023 roadmap : single major EL upgrade and Caplin (CL client)
• Curdleproofs : Go implementation of Whisk for secret single leader election (SSLE)
Curdleproofs : Go implementation of Whisk for secret single leader election (SSLE)
Client releases
• Consensus layer: Prysm v4.0.7 : optimizations include faster slot 0 block proposal, improved fork
choice attestation/aggregation using background routines and reduced lock surface
Consensus layer:
• Prysm v4.0.7 : optimizations include faster slot 0 block proposal, improved fork choice
attestation/aggregation using background routines and reduced lock surface
• Execution layer: Nethermind v1.20.0 : improved logs with color, faster snap sync & improved full
pruning Reth v0.1.0-alpha.3 : hotfix for Grafana metrics
Execution layer:
• Nethermind v1.20.0 : improved logs with color, faster snap sync & improved full pruning
Nethermind v1.20.0 : improved logs with color, faster snap sync & improved full pruning
• Reth v0.1.0-alpha.3 : hotfix for Grafana metrics
Reth v0.1.0-alpha.3 : hotfix for Grafana metrics
For Stakers
• Ethstakers.club beacon explorer, beta, open source using PostgreSQL & Charts.js, MIT license
Ethstakers.club beacon explorer, beta, open source using PostgreSQL & Charts.js, MIT license
• Intel exiting NUC business
Intel exiting NUC business
Research
• EF Research team AMA , discussions on: EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits), RANDAO manipulation, DVT,
EIP7251 (increase max effective balance), SSLE, re-staking, technical roadmap, MEV as a solved
research problem , easier staking, upgrades, one-shot signatures , zk, EF, EIP4844, execution sharding
and rollups
EF Research team AMA , discussions on: EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits), RANDAO manipulation, DVT,
• RANDAO manipulation analysis : no large-scale manipulation detected, manipulators could face
social-slashing
RANDAO manipulation analysis : no large-scale manipulation detected, manipulators could face
• Parallel EVM via claim verification : ensure no inconsistencies when transactions are run in
parallel
Parallel EVM via claim verification : ensure no inconsistencies when transactions are run in parallel
• EF Robust Incentives Group posts, papers & talks
EF Robust Incentives Group posts, papers & talks
Layer 2
• Cross-chain communication : different approaches by L2s
Cross-chain communication : different approaches by L2s
• Polygon zkEVM vulnerability disclosed (fixed), insufficient validation of division remainders
Polygon zkEVM vulnerability disclosed (fixed), insufficient validation of division remainders
EIPs/Standards
• EIPs: Meta EIP7329 : ERC/EIP repository split
EIPs:
• Meta EIP7329 : ERC/EIP repository split
• ERCs (application layer): ERC7303 : Token-controlled token circulation ERC7322 : Soulbounds with
recoverability ERC7331 : Private equity
ERCs (application layer):
• ERC7303 : Token-controlled token circulation
ERC7303 : Token-controlled token circulation
• ERC7322 : Soulbounds with recoverability
ERC7322 : Soulbounds with recoverability
• ERC7331 : Private equity
ERC7331 : Private equity
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Sablier
Sablier V2 is a next-generation token streaming protocol that doubles down on our flagship Lockup
design.
V2 pushes the boundaries of web3 payment protocols:
• Non-linear streaming: exponentials, logarithms, or any other curve
Non-linear streaming: exponentials, logarithms, or any other curve
• Every stream is a transferable NFT
Every stream is a transferable NFT
• Third-party UIs can monetize their Sablier integration with broker fees
Third-party UIs can monetize their Sablier integration with broker fees
Introducing Sablier V2
Stuff for developers
• Foundry: Forge-std v1.6.0 : adds cheat codes readCallers, deployCodeTo, skip(bool) &
assumeAddressIsNot and adds checked_write_int to StdStorage Branching tree technique for Solidity
tests Tip: ABI encode constructor arguments with cast
Foundry:
• Forge-std v1.6.0 : adds cheat codes readCallers, deployCodeTo, skip(bool) & assumeAddressIsNot and
adds checked_write_int to StdStorage
Forge-std v1.6.0 : adds cheat codes readCallers, deployCodeTo, skip(bool) & assumeAddressIsNot and
• Branching tree technique for Solidity tests
Branching tree technique for Solidity tests
• Tip: ABI encode constructor arguments with cast
Tip: ABI encode constructor arguments with cast
• Hardhat v2.17.0 : adds support for solc v0.8.19/20 and Node v20
Hardhat v2.17.0 : adds support for solc v0.8.19/20 and Node v20
• SSTORE3 : library for Code-as-Storage (CaS) pattern, pointer can be packed with other variables
SSTORE3 : library for Code-as-Storage (CaS) pattern, pointer can be packed with other variables
• Diffusc : compare upgradeable contract implementations using static analysis & differential fuzzing
Diffusc : compare upgradeable contract implementations using static analysis & differential fuzzing
• Temo : example of block/account/contract functionality in a terminal UI; uses Ape, Anvil & Textual
Temo : example of block/account/contract functionality in a terminal UI; uses Ape, Anvil & Textual
• Curta CTF Ping Pong solution
Curta CTF Ping Pong solution
• Private market : demo using zk-snarks to sell private keys, signatures and groth16 proofs
Private market : demo using zk-snarks to sell private keys, signatures and groth16 proofs
• RareSkills: converting algebraic circuits to R1CS
RareSkills: converting algebraic circuits to R1CS
• Circom-mutator : mutation testing tool for Circom
Circom-mutator : mutation testing tool for Circom
Security
• Rodeo Finance $880k exploit on Arbitrum via TWAP oracle manipulation
Rodeo Finance $880k exploit on Arbitrum via TWAP oracle manipulation
• Arcadia Finance $460k exploit on mainnet & Optimism via reentrancy
Arcadia Finance $460k exploit on mainnet & Optimism via reentrancy
• Libertify $450k exploit on mainnet & Polygon POS via reentrancy
Libertify $450k exploit on mainnet & Polygon POS via reentrancy
• Ethscriptions marketplace exploit , ownership of deposits could not be validated
Ethscriptions marketplace exploit , ownership of deposits could not be validated
• Trail of Bits: evaluating codebase security maturity
Trail of Bits: evaluating codebase security maturity
• PRBMath signed multiplication-and-division vulnerability disclosed
PRBMath signed multiplication-and-division vulnerability disclosed
Ecosystem
• Active validators reach 655k , churn limit increased to 10 activations/exits per epoch
Active validators reach 655k , churn limit increased to 10 activations/exits per epoch
• Ethereum.org Q3 website roadmap
Ethereum.org Q3 website roadmap
• Etherscan similar contract search updated
Etherscan similar contract search updated
• ETHBarcelona hackathon winners
ETHBarcelona hackathon winners
Enterprise
• Central Bank of Brazil CBDC pilot GitHub repo
Notable at app layer
• Sablier v2 (token streaming): streams represented as transferable NFTs, adds non-linear streams,
cliff support, batch creation and third parties can charge broker fees
Sablier v2 (token streaming): streams represented as transferable NFTs, adds non-linear streams, cliff
support, batch creation and third parties can charge broker fees
• Safe (multisig) adds ERC4337 support for account abstraction
Safe (multisig) adds ERC4337 support for account abstraction
• CoW Hooks : pre & post swap intents can be executed with swaps in single transaction
CoW Hooks : pre & post swap intents can be executed with swaps in single transaction
• 0age Ret↵rn : onchain generative audiovisual (SVG & Web Audio) NFT [Evan & Andrew minted]
0age Ret↵rn : onchain generative audiovisual (SVG & Web Audio) NFT [Evan & Andrew minted]
• Sound (Music NFTs) open to all artists
Sound (Music NFTs) open to all artists
Job Listings
• EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek ZK circuits engineer
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
• SEC vs Ripple summary judgment : institutional sales were securities transactions but programmatic
sales & distributions to employees were not
SEC vs Ripple summary judgment : institutional sales were securities transactions but programmatic
• Alex Mashinsky (former Celsius CEO) charged with fraud
Alex Mashinsky (former Celsius CEO) charged with fraud
• Euler hacker apparently arrested and held in French jail
Euler hacker apparently arrested and held in French jail
• OpenSea spoofer charged with wire fraud
OpenSea spoofer charged with wire fraud
• Google Play policy updated to allow use of NFTs within Android apps & games
Google Play policy updated to allow use of NFTs within Android apps & games
• Bluechip : stablecoin rating agency
Bluechip : stablecoin rating agency
• Ethereum Q2 results imagined as a quarterly earnings release, fees grew 56% quarter-on-quarter
Ethereum Q2 results imagined as a quarterly earnings release, fees grew 56% quarter-on-quarter
Evan’s new podcast: web3 Builders
• Subscribe to web3 Builders podcast. There may be a Week in Ethereum News audio version
General
• Multichain bridge CEO & sister allegedly in custody, MPC nodes were run on CEO’s personal cloud
server account
Multichain bridge CEO & sister allegedly in custody, MPC nodes were run on CEO’s personal cloud server
account
• Polygon propose MATIC token upgrade , 1% emission for validator rewards on Polygon chains & 1% for a
community treasury
Polygon propose MATIC token upgrade , 1% emission for validator rewards on Polygon chains & 1% for a
• Flashbots MEVM : EVM with MEV precompiles to enable rewriting offchain MEV infrastructure as
contracts on upcoming SUAVE
Flashbots MEVM : EVM with MEV precompiles to enable rewriting offchain MEV infrastructure as contracts
on upcoming SUAVE
• Apple WebKit zero-day , arbitrary code execution via malicious web page content
Apple WebKit zero-day , arbitrary code execution via malicious web page content
• Justin Thaler: 17 SNARK misconceptions
Justin Thaler: 17 SNARK misconceptions
• Fiat-Shamir security of FRI & family of FRI-based protocols including Plonky2 & ethSTARK
Fiat-Shamir security of FRI & family of FRI-based protocols including Plonky2 & ethSTARK
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup and
@evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
Permalink for this week’s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-july-15-2023

(new/changes in bold )
• Jul 17 – CLRFund round 9 ends
Jul 17 – CLRFund round 9 ends
• Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)
Jul 17-20 – EthCC (Paris)

Jul 23 – KZG Ceremony closes
